title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it should not be allowed to open in another editor and instead, display an error message.
OB: Close the file. Go to the Java Perspective and open a java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'. Nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message stating that overwriting changes is not allowed and ask if the user wants to continue, or an error message should be displayed indicating that all files need to be closed first. We believe this is a safety feature where WSAD does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor, the workbench should display an error message indicating that the file cannot be opened in another editor and should be closed first before proceeding.
SR:
1. Ensure that you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'.
3. A notepad or WordPad window should pop up with the java file opened.
4. Close the notepad or WordPad window.
5. Go to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double-clicking on it.
6. The file is now opened in the workbench.
7. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'.
8. Verify that the workbench displays an error message stating that the file cannot be opened in another editor until it is closed first.
